content.metaTitle: Living in Jávea (Xàbia) | Property Guide Costa Blanca
content.metaDescription: Complete guide to living in Jávea, Costa Blanca. Discover beaches, lifestyle, property market, golf courses and why international buyers choose Jávea.
content.heroIntro:
Jávea (Xàbia in Valencian) is widely considered the jewel of Costa Blanca North. This picturesque coastal town combines authentic Spanish character with a thriving international community, world-class beaches, and a microclimate that's been officially recognized as one of the healthiest in the world by the World Health Organization.

Unlike the high-rise developments of the southern Costa Blanca, Jávea has maintained strict building regulations that preserve its traditional character. The town is divided into three distinct areas: the historic old town with its Gothic church and traditional architecture, the bustling port area with excellent seafood restaurants, and the Arenal beach zone with its famous sandy beach and promenade.

lifestyleSection.intro:
Life in Jávea moves at a relaxed Mediterranean pace, yet offers everything you need for comfortable modern living. The town attracts a discerning international community—predominantly British, German, and Dutch—who appreciate quality of life over tourist-focused development.

The culinary scene is exceptional, from traditional tapas bars in the old town to Michelin-quality restaurants along the port. Weekly markets, year-round festivals, and an active social calendar mean there's always something happening.
highlights: WHO-recognized microclimate with 300+ sunny days annually
Three distinct zones: Old Town, Port, and Arenal Beach

amenitiesSection.beaches: Jávea boasts over 20 km of coastline with diverse beach options. The Arenal is the main sandy beach with a palm-lined promenade, perfect for families. La Granadella has been voted Spain's best beach multiple times—a stunning cove with crystal-clear waters. For something quieter, hidden coves like Portitxol and Ambolo offer secluded swimming spots.
amenitiesSection.dining: The port area is the culinary heart of Jávea, with restaurants serving fresh-caught seafood daily. Try arroz a banda (local fish rice) or gambas rojas (red prawns) at waterfront terraces. The old town offers traditional Spanish tapas, while Arenal has international cuisine. Several restaurants hold Michelin recommendations.
amenitiesSection.shopping: The old town features boutique shops, artisan stores, and the covered market hall for fresh produce. Arenal has beachwear shops and cafés. For larger shopping, Dénia (15 min) and Ondara (20 min) have major supermarkets and retail parks including a large Carrefour and MediaMarkt.
amenitiesSection.healthcare: Hospital de Dénia (Marina Salud) is a modern private-public hospital just 15 km away, offering comprehensive medical services with English-speaking staff. Jávea has numerous private clinics, dentists, and pharmacies. Many residents also use private health insurance for faster access to specialists.
amenitiesSection.transport: Alicante-Elche Airport is 90 km (approximately 1 hour) via the AP-7 motorway. Valencia Airport is 110 km (1 hour 15 minutes). The town is well-connected by road, though having a car is essential. Local buses connect to Dénia, which has a tram line to Alicante.

content.propertyMarketSection:
The Jávea property market focuses on quality over quantity. New build developments are limited due to strict planning regulations, making each project highly sought after. Most new builds are luxury villas in elevated positions with sea views.

Prices for new build villas typically start around €700,000 for 3-bedroom properties, rising to €2-3 million for premium sea-view villas. The market attracts buyers seeking permanent homes or high-end holiday properties rather than pure investment.

The limited supply of new builds, combined with consistent international demand, has resulted in steady price appreciation. Properties in the sought-after Balcón al Mar and La Corona areas command premium prices for their panoramic sea views.

faqs.question: Is Jávea good for families?
faqs.answer: Jávea is excellent for families. It's a safe, clean town with good schools (including international options in nearby towns), family-friendly beaches, and plenty of outdoor activities. The international community means children easily integrate, and many facilities cater to families.

faqs.question: Do I need to speak Spanish in Jávea?
faqs.answer: While Spanish is helpful, you can manage well with English. The large international community means English is widely spoken in shops, restaurants, and services. However, learning some Spanish will enrich your experience and help with official matters.

faqs.question: What is the climate like in Jávea?
faqs.answer: Jávea enjoys a Mediterranean microclimate with over 300 sunny days per year. Summers are warm (25-32°C) with sea breezes, while winters are mild (12-18°C). Rainfall is low and mainly occurs in autumn. The WHO has recognized this microclimate as one of the healthiest in the world.

faqs.question: How far is Jávea from the airport?
faqs.answer: Alicante-Elche Airport is 90 km from Jávea, approximately 1 hour by car via the AP-7 motorway. Valencia Airport is 110 km, about 1 hour 15 minutes. Both airports have excellent international connections.

faqs.question: Are there golf courses near Jávea?
faqs.answer: Yes, Jávea has excellent golf access. Club de Golf Jávea is a scenic 9-hole course just 5 km from town. La Sella Golf Resort, designed by Olazábal, offers 27 championship holes and is only 15 km away. Both courses welcome visitors year-round.

faqs.question: What healthcare is available?
faqs.answer: Hospital de Dénia is a modern hospital 15 km away with English-speaking staff. Jávea has private medical clinics, dentists, and pharmacies. Many expats use private health insurance (around €100-200/month) for comprehensive coverage.

faqs.question: Is Jávea expensive to live in?
faqs.answer: Jávea is one of the more upmarket areas of Costa Blanca, reflected in property prices and some services. However, daily living costs—groceries, restaurants, utilities—are reasonable compared to Northern Europe. Budget €2,000-3,000/month for a comfortable lifestyle for a couple.

faqs.question: What are property prices in Jávea?
faqs.answer: New build villas in Jávea typically start from €700,000 for 3-bedroom properties and can exceed €3 million for premium sea-view homes. The limited supply of new developments and consistent demand have maintained strong property values.

content.conclusion: Jávea represents the best of Costa Blanca North—natural beauty, authentic character, and sophisticated living without the crowds. Whether you're seeking a permanent home in the Spanish sun or a high-quality holiday property, Jávea delivers an exceptional lifestyle. Contact us today to explore available new build villas in this sought-after location.
